reviews.review_msg: Very passionate and interesting, hardly notice the 2 hours going by in lecture! Makes sure to connect with every student. Inspires different ways of thinking. Expects you to stay right on top of the reading and to be engaged with what you're learning, and there is a lot of work, but if you try you will succeed!
Nice Teacher, runs tutorials, easy essays and marking, tests are a bit tough, interesting lectures
Akin is the most dedicated professor. He makes a personal connection with every student and is clearly passionate about what he does. He's great!

She pushed me to think about issues. I think other students wanted her to just give us 'the answers' but I was happy she made us do the thinking for ourselves. I think this will help me in my 3rd and 4th year!! Thanks Rini!
No Comments

Good prof. Grades are easy to come by, he is willing to help. His lectures are a bit slow and on the dull side, but overall if you put effort into listening it is still interesting. Midterm and final was a list of 40-50 terms, and a few topics. Study them well and this course will be an easy GPA boost.
he is really slow
Magie is very caring and approachable! Lectures are quote-heavy but draw from the readings so it's still understandable. Lots of choice/room for creativity with the assignments.

Her political views varied greatly to my political views. Being on the right and the professor being on the left can lead to a lot of clashes. Never wanted to say anything because it could possibly 'offend' her.

I love Magie! Super interesting course content. Always presented material in a variety of ways, not just dry textbook readings. Tough grader, but scales grades weirdly (85% and above is an A+) so it shakes out OK in the end. I'd love to take a class again with her, and I'm not even a geography major.

I enjoyed most of Magie's class. The topics of the lectures were interesting and covered a variety of relevant social and political issues. Her online lectures were never more than 40 minutes long (2-hr lec. block) but they were quite quote heavy. Tutorials were optional and there were weekly 500-word discussion posts and responses.
Great prof, enjoyed the lectures. Assignments were easy to follow and well explained. Given opportunity for study notes for exams.

Expects too much for a 200 level course. Has been avoiding this class since I first came into SFU but realized that hes the only professor that teaches this class for the past 2 years. Had no other choice but take this class. His lectures are great but very abstract. He does not post slides on canvas

I dont like his teaching style. The concepts are very abstract and he doesnt do the greatest at breaking them down. The lecture slides were no help either. Often there would be a long quote as an explaination of a concept and nothing else. Jason forgets this is only a 200 level course and his expectations are way off.

Don't take this class unless you want to drown in readings. Jason obviously cares about teaching and is a nice person, however, he is VERY unreasonable in his expectations. There is an absurd amount of reading each week and he expects too much on the midterm and final in too short of a time period. He is a very harsh marker. Very abstract material.

Good prof and very knowledgeable, however, there is a lot to do in this course. Long weekly readings and writing 2 pages weekly. The class is also very discussion based and counts as participation. All assignments are essay based. Midterm and final are 3 essay questions..

Great lectures. LOTS of writing. All assignments and exams are essay style. In total 14 or 15 papers, 12 weekly 2page papers and 2 term 6-8 page papers. Midterm was three in-class essays in two hours and expect the same for the final. He does care about teaching and tries to accommodate students, but the material is quite abstract.

The weekly reading assignments were a pain to do, mostly because some of the readings were 20+ pages and there was two in one week. Sometimes he wouldn't post the readings until the following Monday, claims he would post on Friday, it's due on Wednesday. Lots of writing to do, grades one type of student because of that,3 essays in 2 hours for exam!

Jason is an excellent teacher and I hope people take his classes, but I personally wouldn't consider taking another one of his classes again.  I found he didn't have a fully clear marking scheme, and he didn't get back to me on my grades until the end of the course, which left me with a grade I'm not proud of without any way to improve on it.

A very passionate and reasonable teacher. The course content is interesting, especially if you like analyzing the world around you. One caution is that if you want to do all the coursework (which you do), you'd better have a lot of time on your hands. Great class though!
enjoyable class
Lectures are fun and captivating! Hes a pretty funny guy and he really cares about students and that they are enjoying the material

Luckily the TA marked the assignments and exams. There is generally no leeway for critical thinking in her class. Class is pretty easy, did not at all like the textbook since it dismissed several important causations behind homelessness and poverty.
Not a good teacher...  She has some crazy ideas about reality

She was not specific at all as to what she expects of you, even when you ask her (over and over), yet when it comes to marking she has very clear expectations. In other words she makes it difficult for you to do well. When you ask her to clarify something she doesn't, she just tells you to read the assignment again, and she's very rude about it.
She is good proof. As long as attending all lecture and tutorial, you must do very fine with her course.
The TA's marking is brutal and really inconsistant. Teacher lectures directly off power point slides. Assigned readings are more critical than text readings.

His lectures were boring and the tests were on very small concepts that he barely touched on. The TA made up for the lack of information that Paul provided. His lecture topics felt old and out of date, and he used incorrect terminology on more than one occasion.

Paul is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Work hard, read the material (journals) and you will do well. Ask questions if you are unsure. He's not just welcoming to office hours, he encourages it. I will definitely be taking his upper level courses.
Great class and Prof. (easily one of the best @ SFU). Interesting but tough tutorial readings and marking. I think he said the class average was C+ / B- I worked REALLY hard to get a B.

GPA booster. There is no textbook and the only reading is a  journal article (usually around 10 pages) every week for tutorials. He even gives you a study guide for the midterm and final. Attend lecture every week and you'll ace the class with minimal effort.
He is a great teacher! He really tries to motivates the class. Good lecturer, his grading structure is a bit odd. If you get

Paul is a amazing at clearly conveying the material to his students; after every lecture I felt I had a very clear understanding of what he talked about.  He is also the most approachable professor (don't be afraid to go to his office hours).  Memorize the terms on his study guides and work hard on the paper and you'll get an A in this class.

Great prof! He really explains things well! Midterm & final were fair, but becareful, make sure your answers are really detailed or you'll get a lot of marks docked off! Paper is a bit difficult, very broad guidelines but just do your best. Very interesting class and yes, TA Kristin MIlehenney is really good! Funny guy and  you'll love his accent!

He's interested in his subject but tends to get a bit theoretical; learn the terms and years for different theories and the exams are a cinch. Bring in example for Vancouver, he likes them since he's new to this part of the world. Nice guy and pretty casual; if he finishes his lecture early he'll let everyone go. TA Kristin McIlhenney was AWESOME!
Man~~~ what a great prof.... the best in geog department, give out study guide for midterm and final... sure to get a good mark if you study all the terms in the study guide

Great class, best GEOG i've taken so far! Paul is very clear, organized and engaging in lecture. The midterm was very fair. The tutorials are very enjoyable with awesome discussions. The paper was difficult but you get to choose your topic and they are accessible for help. It is good to know there are classes like this where I actually learn & enjo

best geog course ive taken thus far, and one of the best prof's you could ask for.  VERY helpful, VERY approachable.  adds humor to his lectures, very clear, exams more than fair.   he really wants to get to know his students, and is definitely looking out for our well being.  I'll be searching for more classes w/him!
great prof! very clear about course content and expectations. his passion for geography makes lectures pertinent and interesting.
Great prof, very passionate about geography. Clear and interesting lectures. Highly recommended.
